alert.note: Alert for Stanislaus (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 19 at 8:38AM PDT until further notice by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Sacramento has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in California... Tuolumne River At Modesto affecting Stanislaus County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Tuolumne River at Modesto. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 55.0 feet, This is channel capacity through downtown Modesto. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM PDT Sunday the stage was 54.5 feet. - Forecast...Forecast to fluctuate near 54.5 FT thru tomorrow morning. * Impact...Near 55.0 feet, This is channel capacity through downtown Modesto. Near 67.0 feet, Extensive flooding occurs. Flows in excess of 40,000 cfs could cause extensive damage to residential, industrial and commercial development in Modesto downstream of gage. - Monitor stage is 50.5 feet. - Flood stage is 55.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. For more hydrologic information and stage definitions refer to the following web site: wrh.noaa.gov/sto/hydro_data.php The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 845 AM PDT.
